(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{said} \ucAcx\ seDf; vataRmAna \parxpu\\Eva\ \eng{says} \ucAcx\ sesfZ; (\pArxparx) \parxpu vataRmAna \Eva\\eng{saith} \ucAcx\ setf, divxtiVya puruSa vataRmAna \Eva\ \eng{sayst}yA \eng{sayest,} \BU\ \eng{saidst} yA (\viparx) \eng{saidest}). 

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (nidiRSaTx padagaLanunx sAmAnayxvAgi mAtanADuva dhavxniyalilx) heVLu; anunx; enunx; ADu; usiru; nuDi: \eng{`said Damn!'} `hALAgali!' eMdanu. \eng{said that he was satisfied} tanage taqpitxyAyitu eMdu heVLidanu. 
\alnum{b} heVLu; nuDi; padagaLalilxDu; shabadxgaLalilx -- nirUpisu, vayxkatxpaDisu; aBivayxkitxgoLisu: \eng{that was well said} adanunx cenAnxgi yA oLeLxya sheYliyalilx heVLide. \eng{cannot say what I feel} nanage Enu aninxside eMbaudanunx heVLalAre, aBivayxkitxgoLisalAre. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} BaviSayx nuDi; AgutatxdeyeMdu heVLu, tiLisu: \eng{says that there will be war} yudadhx AgutatxdeyeMdu (BaviSayx) heVLutAtxne. 
\num{3} heVLu; nuDi; tiLisu; ukatxvAgiru; nidiRSaTx padagaLalilxru; nidiRSaTx pATha hoMdiru: \eng{the Bible says that thou shalt not steal} niVnu kadiyakUDadu eMdu beYbalf heVLutatxde (beYbalinalilx heVLide). \eng{it says here that he was killed} avanu kolegiVDAdaneMdu ililx ukatxvAgide. \eng{the clock says ten to six} gaDiyAra $6$ gaMTege $10$ nimiSa ideyeMdu heVLutatxde, tiLisutitxde. 
\num{4} (\kaparx dalilx) (daqDhavAgi) heVLalAgiru; nirUpitavAgiru; vaNiRtavAgiru; kaMThoVkatxvAgi ukatxvAgiru: \eng{the tree is said to be six hundred years old} A mara $600$ vaSaRgaLaSuTx haLeyadeMdu heVLalAgide. 
\num{5} (\AmA) (vayxkitxge EnanAnxdarU) mADalu -- heVLu, tiLisu: \eng{he said to bring the car} kAranunx taralu avanu heVLida. 
\num{6} viSaya -- tiLisu, heVLu: \eng{spoke for an hour but didn't say much} oMdu gaMTe mAtanADida, Adare hecucx viSayaveVnanUnx tiLisalillx. 
\num{7} (vAdadalilx) heVLu; vAdavAgi yA nepavAgi -- niVDu, muMdiDu, muMdoDuDx: \eng{there is much to be said on both sides} eraDu pakaSxgaLa paravAgiyU heVLuvudu bahaLavAgide. \eng{have you anything to say for yourself?} ninanx paravAgi heVLuvudu, muMdiDuvudu EnAdarU ideyeV? 
\numi{8} (aneVkaveVLe kamaRpada nirapeVkaSx parxyoVgadalilx) (obabxna yA oMdara viSayavAgi) 
\banum
\alnum{a} aBipArxya heVLu yA tiLisu. 
\alnum{b} niNRya heVLu; nidhARra tiLisu: \eng{there is no saying (\engit{or} it is hard to say ) who it was} avanu yAru yA yArAgidadx eMbaudanunx (KcitavAgi) heVLalAguvudillx (yA heVLuvudu kaSaTx). \eng{do say which you will have} nimage yAvudu beVkenunxvudanunx (nidhARravAgi) tiLisi. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} udAharaNeyAgi tegeduko; daqSATxMtavAgi sivxVkarisu: \eng{any country, say Sweden, might do the same} yAvudeV deVsha, udA. sivxVDanf, adanenxV mADabahudu. 
\num{10} (nidiRSaTx saMKeyx \mo vanunx) sarisumAreMdu eNisu; hatitxra hatitxra samaveMdu BAvisu: \eng{a few of them, say a dozen \engit{or} so} avaralilx kelvaru, sumAru hanenxraDu athavA aSuTx jna. 
\num{11} (pArxthaRne, sotxVtarx, \mo vanunx) heVLu; paThisu; vAcana mADu. 
\num{12} (pATha \mo vanunx) opipxsu; bAyipAThavAgi, kaMThapAThavAgi -- heVLu, punarucacxrisu: \eng{can't say his tables} koVSaTxkavanunx bAyipAThavAgi heVLalAra. 
\num{13} (kale \mo vugaLa \vi) (oLAthaRvanunx yA udedxVshavanunx) heVLu; sUcisu; tiLisu: \eng{what is the director saying in this film?} nideRVshaka I sinimAdalilx tiLisutitxruvudeVnu? 
\num{14} usiru; ucacxrisu. 
\num{15} heVLu; mAtukoDu; Baravase koDu; vacana niVDu; vAgAdxna mADu: \eng{you said you would come} niVnu barutitxVyeMdu heVLidedx, mAtu koTiTxdedx. 
\num{16} Uhisu; kalipxsu; iTuTxko; BAvisu: \eng{say (\engit{or} let us say )} enonxVN; hAgiTuTxkoLoLxVN. \eng{shall we say?} nAvu hAge kalipxsikoLoLxVNveV? \eng{well, say it were true, what then?} sari, adu nijveMdeV iTuTxkoLoLxVN, muMdeVnu?

\bentry
\word{scene}
\pron{siVnf}
\gl{\nA}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (\pArxparx) raMgasathxl; raMgaBUmi; nATkaraMga. 
\num{2} kAyaRkeSxVtarx; kAyaRraMga. 
\num{3} (raMgasathxldalilx parxdashiRtavAguvaMte yAvudeV GaTneyu parxdashiRtavAguva) raMga; jAga; kaLa; sathxLa: \eng{this world is the scene of strife} I loVka (bALu) oMdu hoVrATda kaLa; jiVvanavu oMdu saMgArxmaraMga. 
\num{4} (\AmA) kAyaRda yA Asakitxya keSxVtarx: \eng{not my scene} nananx kAyaRkeSxVtarxvalalx. 
\num{5} bALina -- riVti, vidhAna, parisara: \eng{the political scene} rAjkiVyada parisara. 
\num{6} raMga; GaTnasAthxna; yAvudeV GaTneyu naDeyuva sathxLa: \eng{the scene is laid in India} kirxyAraMgavu iMDiya; GaTneyu naDeyuva sathxLa BArata. \eng{the scene of the disaster was the North Sea} apaGAta naDeda sathxLa utatxrasamudarx Agitutx. 
\numi{7} (nATkada \vi) daqshayx: 
\banum
\alnum{a} (nATka, calnacitarx, pusatxka, \mo vugaLalilx) oMdeV sathxLadalilx, \sA\ pAtarxgaLalilx badalAvaNe illxde, naDeyuva saMgatigaLa viBAga. 
\alnum{b} aMkada oMdu viBAga: \eng{Act II, scene 1} eraDaneya aMka, modalneya daqshayx; divxtiVyAMka, parxthama daqshayx. \eng{the famous duel scene in Hamlet} hAyxmelxTf nATkadalilxna suparxsidadhx davxMdavx yudadhxda daqshayx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} (yAvudeV vayxkitxya jiVvanada oMdu parxmuKvoV sAvxrasayxkaravoV Ada) GaTneya -- kathana, vaNRne, daqshayx: \eng{scenes from clerical life} pAdirx jiVvanada kelvu daqshayxgaLu. 
\num{9} nijjiVvana, kathe, \mo vugaLalilxna yAvudeV GaTne, saMgati: \eng{distressing scenes occurred} viSAdakaravAda GaTnegaLu naDeduhoVduvu. 
\num{10} raMpa; gadadxl; avAMtara; (\kanmu\ itararige mujugaravAguvaMte) koVpa \mo vanunx parxdashiRsuva sAvaRjnika GaTne: \eng{made a scene in the restaurant} hoVTelinalilx oMdu avAMtara mADida. \eng{it was a shameless scene of mutual abuse} adoMdu parasapxra beYdATda mAnageTTx gadadxlvAgitutx. 
\num{11} raMgadaqshayx; siVnu; raMgasathxlda meVle yAvudeV GaTneya daqshayxvanunx parxdashiRsalu odagisuva, vaNRcitarxN mADida paradegaLu, halgegaLu, \mo vu. 
\num{12} raMgasajujx; raMga parxsAdhana; raMgaparxdashaRnakekx beVkAda salkaraNegaLa taMDa. 
\num{13} (sutatxlU haraDiruva) nisagaRda, parxkaqtiya daqshayx yA noVT: \eng{a silvan scene} vanAMtara daqshayx. \eng{a desolate scene} pALunoVT; goVLu kareyutitxruva vijnadaqshayx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{behind the scenes} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (raMgashAle) paradeya, tereya hiMde; neVpathayxdalilx; paradeya hiMde naDeyuva calnavalna, paradeya hiMdiniMda keVLisuva sadudx, \mo vugaLa sUcane. 
\alnum{b} (\rUpa) (tereya) mareyalilx; EkAMtavAgi; goVpayxvAgi; rahasayxvAgi; guTATxgi; jnara kaNiNxge biVLade, kivige keVLade: \eng{the two Prime Ministers carried on the delicate talks behind the scenes} ibabxru parxdhAnigaLU sUkaSxmXvAda I mAtukategaLanunx guTiTxnalilx naDesidaru. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} \eng{behind-the-scenes} (visheVSaNvAgi) teremareya; rahasayx; goVpayx; gUDha: \eng{a behind-the-scenes investigation} teremareya shoVdha. 
\hypertarget{scene pagu(3)}{} 
\num{3} \eng{change of scene} daqshayx badalAvaNe; beVsara, manoVvayxthe, \mo vugaLanunx kaLedukoLuLxva saluvAgi citAtxkaSaRkavAda noVTgaLu, vasutxgaLu, \mo vugaLiruva sathxLakekx yA sathxLagaLige mADuva parxvAsa. 
\num{4} \eng{come on the scene} baru; parxveVshisu; Agamisu. 
\numi{5} \eng{quit the scene} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kAyaRraMgadiMda nigaRmisu; kAyaRkeSxVtarxvanunx biTuTx horaDu. 
\alnum{b} jiVvanaraMgavanunx biTuTx horaDu; ihaloVka biDu, tayxjisu; sAyu. 
\hypertarget{scene pagu(6)}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{set the scene} (kAdaMbari \mo vugaLa \vi) raMga sidadhxgoLisu; GaTnegaLu naDeyuva sathxLa, parisaragaLanunx kaNiNxge kaTuTxvaMte vaNiRsu.

\bentry

\num{3} oLanADina (sihiniVrina) saroVvara: \eng{Sea of Galilee} geliliV saroVvara; geliliV parxdeVshada baLi iruva sihiniVrina saroVvara. 
\num{4} samudarxda sithxti; \kanmu\ alegaLa calne yA sithxtige saMbaMdhisidaMte samudarxda shAMta, parxkuSxbadhx, \mo\ yAvudeV parisithxti: \eng{seas mountains high} beTTxdetatxrada samudarx; pavaRtoVpama samudarx; beTTxdetatxrada alegaLiMda kUDida samudarx. 
\numi{5} (\rUpa) kaDalu; sAgara; samudorxVpama; kaDalinaMthadudx; apAravAdadudx; anaMtavAdadudx; atayxMta vishAlvAdadudx yA BAri motatxdudx: \eng{a sea of troubles} kaSaTxgaLa kaDalu; apAra kaSaTxgaLu. \eng{a sea of grief} duHKAMbaudhi; shoVkasAgara. . (visheVSaNvAgi yA \sapUpa vAgi)

\alnum{b} kaDalinalilx -- huTiTxda, vAsisuva, saMcarisuva, modalAdAdxgi. 
\eanum
\numie

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{all at sea} = \hyperlink{sea pagu2b}{\pagu $(2b)$}. 
\numi{2} \eng{at sea} 
\banum
\alnum{a} kaDalinalilx; samudarxdalilx; BUmiyiMdAce; (\kanmu) BUmige kANdaMte. 
\hypertarget{sea pagu2b}{}

\numie

\num{4} \eng{by sea} kaDal mAgaRvAgi; samudarxda mUlka; haDaginalilx; haDagina mUlka.

\num{6} \eng{go to sea }= \hyperlink{sea pagu5}{\pagu $(5)$}. 
\num{7} \eng{heavy sea} BAri BAri alegaLa samudarx; doDaDx doDaDx teregaLeVLuva kaDalu. 
\num{8} \eng{inland sea} oLanADina kaDalu; sutatxlU pUtiR BUmiyiMda AvarisalpxTTx (yAvudeV) samudarx. 
\num{9} \eng{long sea} udadxneya alegaLa kaDalu; karxmavAgi ududxdadxneya teregaLeVLuva (sAmAnayx) samudarx; niDuderegaLa samudarx. 
\numi{10} \eng{on the sea} 
\banum
\alnum{a} haDaginalilx; kaDalinalilx; samudarxdalilx. 
\alnum{b} kaDal taDiyalilx; kaDal kareyalilx; karAvaLiyalilx; samudarxtiVradalilx: \eng{the town stands on the sea} A paTTxN kaDal kareyalilxde. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{11} \eng{put (out) to sea} reVviniMda horaDu; nela yA baMdaru biTuTx horaDu. 
\num{12} \eng{sea \hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{anemone pagu(1)}{anemone}.}

\bentry

\bnum
\num{1} noVDu; kANu; IkiSxsu: \eng{can you see that fly?} niVnu A noNvanunx noVDabalelxyA? 
\num{2} (mAnasikavAgi yA bwdidhxkavAgi) garxhisu; tiLi; ari; athaR mADiko: \eng{I see what you mean} niVnu heVLuvudu athaRvAyitu; ninanx athaR gotAtxyitu. \eng{could not see the joke} A hAsayx athaRvAgalillx; A hAsayxvanunx athaRmADikoLaLxlAgalillx. 
\num{3} (sinimA, paMdayx, \mo vanunx) noVDu; viVkiSxsu. 
\num{4} (parxshenx yA shoVdhane yA AloVcaneya mUlka) kaMDuhiDi; gotutxmADu; nidhaRrisu: \eng{could you go and see what the children are doing?} niVnu hoVgi makakxLu Enu mADutitxdAdxreMdu noVDutitxVyA? \eng{I will see what I can do to help} sahAya mADalu nAnu Enu mADabahudeMbaudanunx noVDutetxVne, nidhaRrisutetxVne. 
\num{5} yoVcisu; BAvisu; parigaNisu; Uhisu: \eng{I see that you are a brave man} niVnobabx dhe YyaRvaMta eMdu UhisutetxVne. 
\num{6} niriVkiSxsu; muMgANu; muMBAvisu: \eng{we saw that no good would come out of it} adariMda oLeLxyadu EnAdarU AgutatxdeyeMdu nAvu niriVkiSxsalillx. \eng{his colleagues saw him as a future prime minister} avana sahoVdoyxVgigaLu avananunx obabx BAvi parxdhAnamaMtirxyanAnxgi muMgaMDaru. 
\num{7} (\sA\ vidhayxthaRdalilx, pusatxkavoMdanunx yA pusatxkadalilxna BAgavoMdanunx) mAhitigAgi -- noVDu, avaloVkisu: \eng{see page 15} hadineYdaneya puT noVDu. 
\num{8} saMdhisu; BeVTiyAgu; BeVTi mADu; hatitxravidudx gurutisu: \eng{I saw your mother yesterday} nAnu nenenx nimamx tAyiyanunx kaMDe, noVDide, BeVTiyAde. 
\num{9} (pirxya saMgAtiyAgi) yAranAnxdarU niyatavAgi saMdashiRsu, BeVTi mADu, saMpakiRsu yA yAra joteyAdarU savxlpx kAlkaLe: \eng{she does not want to see him any more} inunx muMde avananunx noVDalu, avana jote seVralu avaLige iSaTxvillx. \eng{he is still seeing that short girl} avanu inUnx A kuLiLxyanunx noVDutitxdAdxne, A kuLiLxyoDane saMpakaR iTuTxkoMDidAdxne. 
\num{10} BeVTi koDu; saMdashiRsu: \eng{the doctor will see you today} veYdayxru iMdu ninanxnunx BeVTi mADutAtxre. 
\num{11} salhegAgi -- hoVgu, BeVTi mADu, saMdashiRsu: \eng{went to see the doctor} veYdayxranunx noVDalu hoVda, salhe keVLalu hoVda. 
\num{12} (\kanmu\ daqshayxmUlvoMdariMda) ari; tiLi; noVDidadxriMda garxhisu: \eng{I see the show has been cancelled} parxdashaRna radAdxdudanunx (patirxke, parxkaTne, \mo vanunx noVDi, Odi) arite. 
\num{13} noVDu; kANu; aBipArxya taLe yA athaR kalipxsu: \eng{I see things differently now} viSayagaLu Iga nanage beVre riVti kANutitxve; Iga nAnu viSayagaLanunx beVre daqSiTxyiMda noVDutetxVne (avugaLa bagegx beVre aBipArxyagaLanunx taLeyutetxVne). \eng{try to see the matter from her point of view} viSayavanunx avaLa daqSiTxkoVnadiMda noVDalu, athaR mADikoLaLxlu parxyatinxsu. \eng{I see it as being quite possible} Iga adu saMpUNRvAgi sAdhayxveMdu nanage kANutatxde (toVrutatxde). 
\num{14} (yAvudanenxV) BAvisiko; Uhisiko; kalipxsiko; manasisxnalilx citirxsiko: \eng{cannot see him agreeing to it} avanu adakekx opipxkoLuLxtAtxneMdu kalipxsikoLaLxlAre. 
\num{15} kANu; anuBavadiMda ari; anuBavisu: \eng{he has seen a great deal in his long life} sudiVGaR jiVvanadalilx avanu bahaLaSuTx kaMDidAdxne, anuBavisidAdxne. \eng{whoever can see death?} yAru tAne maqtuyxvanunx (parxtayxkaSx vAgi) kANballxru? \eng{I never saw such a mess} iMtha holsanunx, avayxvasethxyanunx nAnu eMdU kaMDillx. 
\num{16} manasAre opupx; samamxtisu: \eng{do you see your daughter marrying this man?} ninanx magaLu I manuSayxnanunx maduveyAguvudanunx opupxtitxVyA? 
\num{17} (madhayxparxveVsha mADade) sumamxne noVDikoMDiru; sAkiSxyAgiru; noVDutAtx niMtiru; sahisikoMDiru: \eng{are you going to see me treated like this?} nanage hiVge mADutitxruvudanunx (taDeyade yA taDeyalu yatinxsade) sumamxne noVDutAtx niMtirutitxVyA? 
\num{18} (yAvudeV kelsa \mo vanunx) noVDiko; meVlivxcAraNe mADu; vayxvasethxgoLisu: \eng{see all the doors locked before you leave} niVnu hoVguva modalu elAlx bAgilugaLigU biVga hAkideyeV noVDu. \eng{see that it is done} A kelsa AguvaMte noVDiko, EpARDu mADu. \eng{see (that) you don't catch your foot} ninanx kAlu sikikxhAkikoLaLxdaMte ecacxra vahisu. 
\num{19} AkaSaRNe kANu: \eng{can't think what she sees in him} avanalilx Enu AkaSaRNe kANutAtxLoV tiLiyadu. 
\num{20} (oMdu sathxLa \mo vakekx gwravAthaRvAgi yA biTuTxbaralu vayxkitxgaLa) joteyalilx, saMgaDa, oDane, oMdige -- hoVgu: \eng{may I see you home?} nimomxDane maneyavaregU baraleV? nimamxnunx manege biTuTx baraleV? 
\num{21} (yAvudeV saMgati, GaTne, parisithxti, \mo vanunx) kANu; noVDu; perxVkaSxkanAgiru; sAkiSxyAgiru: \eng{saw the New Year in} hosa vaSaR udisidadxnunx, pArxraMBavAdudanunx kaMDe. \eng{has seen his income gradually decrease} tananx varamAna karxmeVN kugugxtitxruvudanunx kaMDidAdxne. 
\num{22} (yAvudeV saMBavisuva, naDeyuva) kAl yA parxdeVsha yA parisithxti -- Agiru: \eng{this year sees the birth of a new movement} I vaSaR hosa caLavaLiyoMdara udayavanunx, huTTxnunx kANutatxde. \eng{this stadium has seen many thrilling matches} I kirxVDAMgaN aneVka roVmAMcaka paMdayxgaLanunx kaMDide; I kirxVDAMgaNdalilx aneVka roVmAMcakAri paMdayxgaLu jrugive. 
\numi{23} (jUjATdalilx, \kanmu\ poVkarf isipxVTATdalilx) savAlopupx; bAji -- samanAgisu, samamADu: 
\banum
\alnum{a} (edurALi kaTiTxda bAjige) samanAda bAjikaTuTx; (edurALi kaTiTxda bAjiya) samakekx (tananx) bAji Erisu. 
\alnum{b} (\kanmu\ eduru ATgArana elegaLanunx noVDalu avana) samanAda bAji kaTuTx. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} daqSiTx(shakitx)- iru, hoMdiru: \eng{he cannot see} avanu noVDalAra; avanu kuruDa. \eng{some animals see best at night} kelvu pArxNigaLu rAtirx hotutx bahaLa cenAnxgi noVDutatxve; kelvu pArxNigaLige rAtirx hotutx kaNuNx bahaLa cenAnxgi kANisutatxde. 
\num{2} noVDu; kANu; IkiSxsu; kaNiNxna mUlka garxhisu: \eng{you can see for miles from the tower} niVnu goVpurada meVliMda meYligaLaSuTx dUra noVDabahudu. 
\num{3} bwdidhxkavAgi yA mAnasikavAgi garxhisu, ari. 
\num{4} gamana koDu; manasusx koDu: \eng{see to it that the work is done} kelsa neraveVruvudakekx gamana koDu. 
\num{5} vicAra mADu; payARloVcisu; yoVcane mADu; hecucx gotAtxguvavarege tALu, taDe: \eng{we shall have to see} nAvu yoVcane mADabeVku; nAvu kAyudx noVDabeVku.

\num{8} noVDiko; KAtarigoLisu; KAtaripaDisu: \eng{see that he returns safely} avanu surakiSxtavAgi vApasAguvudanunx KAtaripaDisu, noVDiko.

\bentry
\word{seem}
\pron{siVmf}
\gl{\kirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
(hAge, hAgiruvaMte) toVru, kANu: \eng{be what you seem (\engit{or} seem to be)} toVruvaMte iru; niVnu EnAgiruvaMte kANutitxVyoV adeV Agiru; iruvudeV oMdu, toVruvudeV oMdu, AgabeVDa; soVgu hAkabeVDa; kapaTi AgirabeVDa; ASADhaBUtiyAgirabeVDa. \eng{he seemed to be the ringleader} avaneV guMpina muKMDanAgi kaMDa. \eng{he seems to be tired} AyAsagoMDavanaMte toVrutAtxne. \eng{he seems to be a good fellow} avanu oLeLxya AsAmiyaMte kANutAtxne. \eng{he is not the angel he seems to be} (noVDuvudakekx) avanu heVge kANutAtxnoV aMtha deVvate, sherxVSaThx vayxkitx EnU allx. \eng{I seem to see him still} avananunx nAnu (nananx kaNeNxdurinalilx) kANutitxruvaMte toVrutitxde. 
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{can't seem to do (something)} (\AmA) (yAvudanenxV) mADalAre yA mADalAra (\mo) eMdu, toVru: \eng{somehow I can't seem to write anything to-day} ivatutx EkoV EnanUnx bareyaleV Are eMdu toVrutitxde; ivatutx EkoV EnanUnx bareyalu AgadaMtide. 
\num{2} \eng{do not seem to} (\AmA) EkoV Agutitxllx : \eng{I do not seem to like him} avananunx kaMDare nanageVkoV Agutitxllx. 
\num{3}\eng{it seems that . . .} aMte: \eng{it seems that you were lying} niVnu suLuLx heVLutitxdadxMte toVrutatxde. 
\num{4} \eng{it seems to me that etc. . . .} eMdu nanage toVrutatxde: \eng{it seems to me that it will rain today} ivatutx maLe baruvudeMdu nanage toVrutatxde. \eng{it seems to me that such talk is absurd} iMtaha mAtu asaMbadadhxveMdu nanage toVrutitxde. 
\num{5} \eng{it would (\engit{or}} \pArxparx\ \eng{should) seem etc.} (apirxyavAda aBipArxya \mo vanunx koDuvAga, jAgarUka sheYliyalilx mAtanADuva riVti) -- eMdu toVrutatxde. \eng{it would seem that the contemplated scheme is not practicable} Iga yoVcisutitxruva yoVjneyu vayxvahAyaRvallxveMdu toVrutatxde; Iga yoVcisutitxruva yoVjneyanunx kAyaRrUpakekx taralAguvudillxvenisutatxde. 
\num{6} \eng{seem good to} sariyAgiruvudAgi kANu; oLeLxyadu eMdu toVru: \eng{this course seems good to me} I vidhAnavu oLeLxya dAri eMdu nanage toVrutatxde. 
\num{7} \eng{so . . . (\engit{or} it seems)} AdadxriMda . . . . aMte: \eng{so we are to get nothing, it seems} AdadxriMda namage EneVnU siguvudillx vaMte, namage EneVnanUnx koDuvudillxvaMte. 
\num{8} \eng{what seemeth him good} (\pArxparx) yAvudanunx avanu oLeLxyadeMdu BAvisu tAtxnoV (adu). 
\enum
\emng
\eentry

\num{5} (vANijyx, vayxvahAra, \mo vugaLalilx yA \AmA dalilx) tAnu: \eng{myself, himself,} itAyxdi: \eng{cheque drawn to self} tanageV, tananx hesarigeV bareda cekukx; haNvanunx tAneV paDeyalu bareda cekukx. \eng{a ticket admitting self and friend} tananxnUnx (tananx obabx) senxVhitananUnx oLakekx biDuva TikeTuTx; tAnU obabx senxVhitanU parxveVsha paDeyabahudAda TikeTuTx. \eng{his very self} avaneV. \eng{your good selves} niVvugaLu.

\bentry

\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} iMdirxya shakitx; karaN sAmathaRyx; (kaNuNx, kivi, \mo\ paMceVMdirxya gaLu) hoMdiruva, ariyuva yA saMveVdaneya -- shakitx: \eng{dull sense of smell} maMdavAda GArxNshakitx. 
\num{2} jAcnxneVMdirxya; karaN ariyuva shakitxyuLaLx deVhada iMdirxya: \eng{the five senses} (bAhayx parxpaMcavanunx aritukoLaLxlu sAdhanagaLAda) dashaRna, sharxvaN, GArxN, rasanA matutx sapxshaR eMba paMca saMveVdanegaLu. 
\num{3} (\bava dalilx) (vayxkitxya) baudidhx; parxjecnx; jAcnxna; viveVka. 
\num{4} (vasutxgaLa asitxtavx, guNgaLanunx noVDuva, ariyuva, sapxshiRsi tiLiyuva) iMdirxyagaLa -- sUkaSxmXte, pATva, paTutavx. 
\num{5} (yAvudaradeV) arivu; parxjecnx; jAcnxna: \eng{the senses of pain} noVvina arivu. \eng{the sense of shame} avamAnada parxjecnx. \eng{the sense of responsibility} hoNegArikeya arivu; jvAbAdxriya parxjecnx. 
\num{6} arivu; parxjecnx; vasutxvanunx, viSayavanunx, parisithxtiyanunx kUDaleV aritukoLuLxva tiVkaSx Nx shakitx yA parisithxtiyananxritu takakxMte naDedukoLuLxva sahaj shakitx: \eng{a sense of locality} saninxveVshada arivu. \eng{sense of the ridiculous} hAsayxgarxhaN; hAsAyxsapxdavAdadadxnunx hAgeMdu kUDaleV garxhisuva shakitx. \eng{a sense of humour} hAsayxparxjecnx. \eng{a sense of duty} kataRvayxparxjecnx. \eng{a sense of gratitude} kaqtajacnxtA BAva(ne). \eng{a keen sense of honour} tiVvarxvAda gwravaparxjecnx, mayARdAparxjecnx; tananx gwravakekx kaLaMka tarabAradeMba utakxTvAda haMbal. 
\num{7} vayxvahArajAcnxna; parijAcnxna; aucitayxparxjecnx; yukAtxyakatx viveVka; viveVcana (shakitx); baudidhx: \eng{he has sound (\engit{or} good) sense} avanige oLeLxya (pari)jAcnxna, viveVka, ide. \eng{he had not the sense to do it} adanunx mADuvaSuTx jAcnxna, viveVka, avanige iralillx. \eng{what is the sense of talking like that?} hAge mAtanADuvudara aucitayx Enu? \eng{I have more sense than to do such a stupid thing} aMtha muTAThxLa kelsa mADuvudakikxMta hecucx baudidhx, viveVcane nanage ide. \eng{now you are talking sense} Iga niVnu mAtanADutitxruvudu viveVka. 
\num{8} padada, padagaLa -- athaR; mAtina -- udedxVsha, Ashaya, tAtapxyaR, mamaR, iMgita: \eng{the sense of the word is clear} I padada athaR sapxSaTxvAgiyeV ide. \eng{the strict sense of the word} I padada niSakxqqSaTxvAda athaR. \eng{literal sense} akaSxrashaH athaR; vAcAyxthaR. \eng{figurative, metaphorical sense} rUpakAthaR, AlMkArika athaR. \eng{legal sense} nAyxyashAsatxrXda riVtAyx athaR. \eng{full sense} pUNARthaR. \eng{in a vague sense} anidiRSaTx, asapxSaTx athaRdalilx; sUthxl athaRdalilx. \eng{in every sense} samasatx athaRdalUlx. 
\num{9} sAmAnayx aBipArxya; sAmAnAyxBimata; halvu maMdiya oTuTx aBipArxya: \eng{take the sense of the meeting} saBeya (sAmAnayx) aBipArxyavanunx, aBimatavanunx tegeduko. 
\num{10} athaRvaMtike; athaRvAguvaMtiruvike; athaR hoMdiruvike; susaMbadadhxvAgiruvike. 
\numi{11} (\ga\ \mo vu) dishe: 
\banum
\alnum{a} calneya dikukx. 
\alnum{b} dhanaveV \eng{(positive)} athavA QuNveV \eng{(negative)} eMba mAhiti. 
\eanum
\numie
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{be frightened out of one's senses} gAbariyiMda baudidhx sAvxdhiVna tapipxhoVgu: \eng{at the very sight of the cobra, he was frightened out of his senses} A nAgarahAvanunx noVDidaSaTxkekxV gAbariyiMda avanige baudidhx sAvxdhiVna tapipxhoVyitu. 
\num{2} \eng{be in one's senses} parxjecnx sariyAgiru; baudidhx sAvxdhiVnadalilxru, neTTxgiru: \eng{are you in your senses?} ninage baudidhx sariyAgideyoV illxvoV? 
\num{3} \eng{be out of one's senses} baudidhx -- keTiTxru, neTTxgillxdiru; viveVkashUnayxvAgiru: \eng{he is out of his senses} avanige baudidhx keTiTxde; avanige viveVka hoVgibiTiTxde. 
\numi{4} \eng{bring a person to his (\engit{or} her) senses} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (mUCiRta vayxkitxyanunx) ecacxrakekx taru; parxjecnx barisu.

\numie

\bentry

(sahAyaka matutx parxdhAna \kirx) [
\banum
\alnum{a} utatxmapuruSa, \Eva\ \bava, BaviSayxtfkAl, vataRmAnagaLa rUpa: \eng{shall; I, we, shall,} yA \eng{'ll;} niSeVdhAthaRkavAgi \eng{I, we, shall not} yA \AmA\ \saMkiSx\ -- \eng{I, we, shan't} (\ucAcx\ SAnfTx). 
\alnum{b} madhayxmapuruSa, \pArxparx\ \Eva\ \eng{thou shalt}. 
\alnum{c} BUta \rUpa, utatxmapuruSa, \Eva, \bava\ \eng{shall I, we, should} \ucAcx\ Su(Sa)Df, niSeVdhAthaRkavAgi \eng{I, we, shouldn't} (\ucAcx\ SuDfnfTx). 
\alnum{d} madhayxmapuruSa, \Eva, \pArxparx\ \eng{thou shouldst} (\ucAcx\ SuDfsx Tx) yA \eng{thou shouldest} (\ucAcx\ SuDisfTx) niSeVdhAthaRkavAgi \eng{should not}, (\AmA) \eng{shouldn't} (\ucAcx\ SuDfnfTx).] 
\bnum
\numi{1} (sahAyaka \kirx ) (utatxmapuruSadalilx) (sAmAnayxvAkayx, saMBAvanArUpa matutx parxshAnxthaRka vAkayxgaLalilx): 
\alnum{a} (sAmAnayx vAkayxdalilx) \eng{shall hear about it tomorrow} adara viSayavAgi namage nALe keVLibaruvudu, tiLiyuvudu yA tiLiyutatxde. \eng{shall hear from you soon?} nininxMda nanage sudidx beVga baruvudeV, barutatxdeyeV, baruvuduMToV? 
\alnum{b} (saMBAvanAthaRkavAgi) \eng{if I had let go, I should have been killed} hiDita biTuTxbiTiTxdadxre nAnu satutx hoVgutitxdedx. \eng{any one who should say so} hAge heVLuva yAvanAdarU. \eng{if he should happen to be there} avanu alilxdadxlilx. \eng{should I hear from you in that case?} A saMdaBaRdalilx, hAgAdalilx, nininxMda samAcAra tiLiyuva saMBavavuMTe? 
\alnum{c} (otitx heVLidAga) daqDhasaMkalpxsUcakavAgi: \eng{I shall return without fail} nAnu tapapxde hiMdiruguvenu, hiMdirugiyeV tiVrutetxVne. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} (madhayxmapuruSa matutx parxthamapuruSagaLalilx) mAtanADutitxruvavana iceCxyanunx sUcisuvudakikxMtalU hecAcxgi 
\banum
\alnum{a} daqDhasaMkalpxda sUcakavAgi: \eng{you shall not catch me again} nananxnunx niVnu matetx hiDiya lAguvudillx; niVnu nananxnunx hiDiyalu nAnu matetx eDegoDuvudillx. \eng{he should not have gone if I could have prevented it} avananunx taDeyalu nanage sAdhayxvAgididxdadxre, avanu hoVgalu AgutatxleV iralillx. 
\alnum{b} AjAcnxsUcakavAgi: \eng{they shall not go} avaru hoVgakUDadu. \eng{I (you, he) should have been careful} nAnu (niVnu, avanu) ecacxrikeyiMdirabeVkAgitutx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} Ajecnx yA kataRvayx sUcisuvAga: \eng{thou shalt not steal} niVnu kadiyakUDadu. \eng{they shall obey} avaru vidheVyarAgi pAlisabeVku. 
\num{4} (madhayxmapuruSa parxshenxgaLalilx) (\kanmu\ beVDikeya rUpakekx badalAgi baLasuva) parxshAnxthaRka rUpavAgi: \eng{shall you go to England?} niVnu iMgelxMDige hoVgutitxVyA? 
\hyperdef{S}{shall(5)}{} 
\num{5} (yAvudeV puruSadalilx) udedxVshasUcaka upavAkayxdalilx \eng{may} yA \eng{might} sahAyaka kirxyApadagaLa badalu \eng{shall} yA \eng{should} parxyoVgavuMTu -- \udA\ \eng{in order that I (you, he) shall \engit{or} should not be able} nAnu (niVnu, avanu) samathaRnAgadiraleMdu yA nanage, ninage, avanige, sAdhayxvAgadirali eMba udedxVshadiMda.

\bentry

\pron{SUTf}

\expl{(\BU\ matutx \BUkaq\ \eng{shot} \ucAcx\ SATf) }


\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} tiVra veVgavAgi, raBasadiMda -- kaLuhisu, ese, oge, horahAku, dabaubx: \eng{the bow shoots arrows} bilulx bANgaLanunx ogeyutatxde. \eng{the gun shoots out missiles} baMdUku kiSxpaNigaLanunx eseyutatxde. \eng{the coaches collided and shot out the passengers} A reYlugADigaLu parasapxra Dikikx hoDedu parxyANikaranunx horakekxsedubiTuTxvu. 
\alnum{b} (kiraN \mo vugaLa \vi) biVru; sUsu; mUDisu: \eng{the sun shoots his rays} sUyaRnu tananx kiraNgaLanunx biVrutAtxne. \eng{trees shoot out their new twigs} maragaLu tamamx hosa reMbegaLanunx mUDisutatxve. \eng{he shot a glance at his neighbour} avanu tananx nereyavana(La) kaDege OrenoVT biVrida. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} (kasa \mo vanunx bauTiTx, toTiTx, lAri \mo vugaLiMda) suri; celulx; ese; hAku: \eng{she shot the rubbish out of the basket} Ake kasakaDiDxyanunx bauTiTxyiMda horakekx suridaLu, esedaLu. 
\num{3} (kadada cilkavanunx BadarxpaDisalu yA tegeyalu, aguLiyanunx, tApALanunx) raBasadiMda -- hAku, taLuLx, nUku yA eLe. 
\num{4} (PiraMgi, bilulx, \mo vugaLiMda) guMDu, bAN, \mo vanunx -- eseyisu, hArisu, hAruvaMte mADu. 
\num{5} (bilulx, baMdUku, \mo vugaLa mUlka) bAN, guMDu, \mo\ kiSxpaNiyanunx -- hArisu, parxkeSxVpisu, ese. 
\num{6} (vayxkitxyanunx yA pArxNiyanunx baMdUku, bilulx, \mo vugaLiMda) guMDu, bAN, \mo vanunx parxyoVgisi -- gAyagoLisu yA kolulx. 
\num{7} (vayxkitxyanunx shikeSxya rUpadalilx) baMdUkiniMda, bANdiMda -- kolulx. 
\num{8} (pode, jmInu, \mo vugaLalilxruva beVTe pArxNiyanunx, vanayx maqgavanunx) beVTeyADu; SikAri mADu; guMDikikx yA bAN hoDedu kolulx. 
\num{9} (\kanmu\ phuTfbAlf) ceMDanunx birusAgi odedu goVlf mADu. 
\num{10} (gAlfphx, \AmA) sutotxMdakekx nidiRSaTx saMKeyxya sokxVrf gaLisu, mADu. 
\num{11}(daqshayx, vayxkitx, \mo vara) calnacitarx yA BAvacitarx tege. 
\numi{12} (\ame, \AmA) 
\banum
\alnum{a} kArxYxpfsx, pUlf, \mo\ ATvADu. 
\alnum{b} (dALa) ese; hAku; uruLisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{13} (doVNiya \vi) (seVtuve, jlpAta, \mo vugaLa) aDiyalilx yA (iLijAru parxvAhada) meVle veVgavAgi sAgu; birusAgi hoVgu. 
\num{14} (\ashi) (mAdaka vasutxvanunx) tAneV, tanageV -- cucicxko. 
\num{15} (\AmA) (cwkadalilx, vaqtatxdalilx keMpudiVpa toVrisutitxdadxrU rasetxyanunx) -- dATu, hAdu hoVgu, atikarxmisi hoVgu. 
\num{16} (halgeyoMdara ENnunx, aMcanunx OrekoVreyillxdaMte) samanAgi yA karAruvAkAkxgi -- hatatxri hoDe, samaru, nayagoLisu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} veVgavAgi, birusAgi -- calisu; raBasadiMda -- baru yA hoVgu: \eng{the boat shot out from the creek} doVNiyu KAriyiMda horakekx raBasadiMda baMtu yA horaTitu. 
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (giDada \vi) kuDiyiDu; cigaroDe; konaru; ciguru; aMkurisu. 
\alnum{b} (giDada \vi) mogugx biDu; mogugx kacucx. 
\alnum{c} (ciguru, mogugxgaLa \vi) moLe; kANisiko. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} (kirxkeTf ceMDina \vi) nelkekx baDidu, puTveVLade -- nelsamakekx uruLu, neldudadxkUkx ODu. 
\numi{4} (noVvina \vi) 
\banum
\alnum{a} caLuku -- koDu, huTiTxsu, niVDu. 
\alnum{b} (beVrAvudeV avayavada \vi) niMtu niMtu caLaku -- baru, noVyu, yAtaneyAgu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} idadxkikxdadxMte horaTuko; muMcAcu; horacAcu; cAciko: \eng{the cape shoots out all at once} A BUshiravu idadxkikxdadxMte muMcAcikoMDide. 
\num{6} (\kanmu\ nidiRSaTx riVtiyalilx) baMdUku \mo vanunx hArisu, biDu: \eng{he shoots straight} avanu neVravAgi baMdUku hArisutAtxne, bAN biDutAtxne. 
\numi{7} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (bAN, guMDu, \mo\ kiSxpaNigaLa \vi, bilulx, baMdUku, \mo vugaLiMda)hAru; parxkeSxVpavAgu. 
\alnum{b} (baMdUkina \vi) hAru; hoDe. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{8} 
\banum
\alnum{a} baMdUkiniMda pArxNi yA vanayxmaqga beVTeyADu. 
\alnum{b} jmInu \mo vugaLalilx (pArxNiya) beVTeyADu; SikAri mADu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{9} (\kanmu\ phuTfbAlf) ceMDanunx goVlige birusAgi ode. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent 
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{shoot !} (\ame, \ashi) odaribiDu; birabirane heVLibiDu. 
\num{2} \eng{shoot ahead} (sapxdhiRgaLu \mo vara \vi) muMBAgakekx, muMcUNige, agarxsAthxnakekx -- beVga baru. 
\num{3} \eng{shoot a line} (\birx\ \AmA) yAvudanenxV vipariVta utepxrXVkiSxsi, naMbalAgadaMte yA ADaMbaradiMda -- heVLu, vaNiRsu. 
\numi{4} \eng{shoot down} 
\banum

\alnum{b} (PiraMgi \mo vanunx hArisi vimAna yA vimAnacAlkananunx) nelkikxLisu; hoDedu uruLisu; hoDedu keDavu. 
\alnum{c} (vayxkitx, yAvudeV salhe, \mo vakekx virudadhxvAgi) balvAgi vAdisu; pariNAmakAriyAgi, parxbal -- vAda hUDu.

\num{6} \eng{shoot one's \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bolt(1) nuga(2)}{${}^1$bolt}.} 
\num{7} \eng{shoot one's cuffs} SaTiRna maNikaTuTx paTiTxyanunx (parxdashiRsalu, toVrisikoLaLxlu) odaru, koDavu. 
\num{8} \eng{shoot oneself in the foot} (\aupa) alkaSxyXdiMda, ajAgarUkateyiMda -- tanageV toMdare mADiko, tananx kAlnenxV muriduko, iruva sithxtiyanunx inanxSuTx keDisiko.

\numie
\num{10} \eng{shoot out} (\pArxparx) (tuTi \mo vanunx, \kanmu\ aNkisuva saluvAgi) horacAcu; muMdakekx niVDu. 
\num{11} \eng{shoot the breeze (\engit{or} the bull)} (\kanu\ \ame, \AmA) mAtukateyADu; anwpacArikavAgi mAtanADu; sAMparxdAyika mAtukateyalilx toDagu.

\numi{4} (uDupanunx) 
\banum

\alnum{b} AturavAgi kaLacu, tegedu hAku: \eng{slip on (\engit{or} over) a shirt} beVga SaTuR tagulisiko. \eng{slip off a shirt} beVga SaTuR kaLacu. . kaLaciko; tapipxsiko; jAriko; nuNuciko; keYkoDu; gasutx koDu: \eng{dog slips his collar} nAyi koraLapaTiTxyiMda kaLacikoLuLxtatxde. \eng{the prisoner slipped his guard} keYdi avana kAvalugAranige gasutx koTTx, kAvalugAraniMda tapipxsikoMDa. \eng{the point had slipped my attention} A aMsha nananx gamanadiMda tapipxsikoMDitutx, jAritutx.

\bentry

\bnum
\numi{1} (sigareVTu \mo vugaLa) hoge -- seVdu, kuDi, seVvisu: 
\banum
\alnum{a} seVduva vasutxvanAnxgi baLasu: \eng{smoke tobacco, opium} taMbAku, aphiVmu -- seVdu. 
\alnum{b} seVduva sAdhanavAgi baLasu: \eng{smoke a pipe, cigarette} koLave, sigareVTu -- seVdu. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{2} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hogeyiTuTx kapupx mADu, kapupx kaTiTxsu: \eng{lamp smokes the ceiling} diVpa hogeyiMda cAvaNiyanunx kapupx kaTiTxsutatxde. \eng{smoked wood} hogeyiMda kapupx kaTiTxda, kapApxda -- mara. 
\alnum{b} (keDadaMte iDalu) hogeyADisu; hoge hiDisu: \eng{smoked ham} hogeyADisida haMdi toDeya mAMsa. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} (aDugeyanunx) hoge vAsane mADu; hoge sutitxsu; hoge hatitxsi (aDuge) ruci keDisu. 
\numi{4} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (huLu hupapxTegaLanunx ODisalu, nAshapaDisalu) hogehAku; hogeyiTuTx ODisu, nAshamADu: \eng{smoke insects} hogeyiTuTx huLugaLanunx nAshapaDisu, kolulx. \eng{smoke plants} hoge hAki (huLugaLanunx koMdu) giDagaLanunx shudidhxgoLisu. 
\alnum{b} (huLugaLanunx, kiVTgaLanunx, \kanmu\ duMbigaLanunx) hoge hAki aDagisu, nigarxhisu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} (\pArxparx) geVli, hAsayx, leVvaDi -- mADu. 
\num{6} hoge seVdi seVdi oMdu sithxtige taMduko: \eng{smoked himself sick} hoge seVdi seVdi kAyile taMdukoMDidAdxne. 
\num{7} hogeyiTuTx -- asapxSaTxgoLisu, mAsalu mADu. 
\num{8} hogeyiMda -- usiru kaTiTxsu, usirADadaMte mADu. 
\num{9} (\pArxparx) (oMdara) suLivu tiLi; vAsane hiDi; shaMkisu.

\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hoge -- Agu, ADu, iDu, sUsu, biDu, kAru, ELu: \eng{smoking ruins} hoge kArutitxruva avasheVSagaLu. 
\alnum{b} (diVpa \mo vugaLa \vi) hoge biDu; hoge hatutx; hoge sUsutatx sariyAgi uriyadiru: \eng{lamp is smoking} diVpa hoge biDutitxde. 
\alnum{c} (hogegUDu, beMkigaLa \vi) hoge -- mADu, kaTiTxsu, kavisu; koLaveya mUlka hogeyanunx horakekx kaLuhisuvudara badalu rUminoLakekx, maneyoLakekx biDu. 
\eanum
\numie

\banum

\alnum{b} (sigareVTu \mo vanunx) aBAyxsavAgi, cALiyAgi seVdu. 
\eanum
\numie

\num{6} sarakakxne phoVToV tege; kaSxNdalilx CAyAcitarx hiDi. 
\num{7} (\ame, kAlecxMDAT) ceMDanunx ATdalilx toDagisalu taTTxne hiMdakekx ode yA hiMdakekx pAsu koDu. 
\num{8} kacicx hAku; kaDidubiDu; taTkakxne kaDidu beVpaRDisu.

\noindent

\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} lTTxne muriduhoVgu; caTTxne kaDiduhoVgu; paTkakxne kitutxhoVgu: \eng{the branch snapped} reMbe lTTxne muridu hoVyitu. \eng{the wire snaps} taMti caTTxne kaDiduhoVgutatxde, kitutxhoVgutatxde. 
\num{2}caTf, Dabf, paTArf, caTArf -- enunx; caTguTuTx: \eng{pistol snaps} pisUtxlu DabArenunxtatxde. \eng{whip snaps} cAvaTi caTArenunxtatxde. 
\num{3} DabArane mucicxko yA tegeduko; dopapxne hAkiko yA tereduko: \eng{the door snapped behind her} avaLa hiMde bAgilu dabArane hAkikoMDitu. 
\num{4} (vayxkitx) siDuguTuTx; siDuku mAtADu; haritavAgi, kaTuvAgi -- mAtanADu; cucucxvaMte, noVyuvaMte, reVgi, kaDiDx murida hAge -- mAtADu yA utatxra koDu: \eng{did not mean to snap at you} ninonxDane kaTuvAgi mAtanADuva udedxVshaviralillx. 
\num{5} (\kanmu\ nAyi \mo vugaLa \vi) gabakakxne kacucx; Pakakxne, kaTumamxne -- kaDi; shabadxvAguvaMte taTTxne kacucx, kaDi: \eng{dog snapped viciously} nAyi taTkakxne balvAgi kacicxtu. 
\num{6} curukAgi calisu: \eng{snap into action} kiSxparxvAgi kAyoRVnumxKnAgu. \eng{snap to attention} beVga `sAvadhAna' da niluvu nilulx. 
\num{7} (\CA) sarakakxne phoVToV tege; (\kanmu) vayxkitx yA vasutx citarx tegeyalu aNiyAgadiruvAga kiSxparxvAgi citarx tege.

\noindent

\expl{}
\bmng

\bentry

\gl{\kirxvi}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} aSuTx; iSuTx; aSoTxMdu; iSoTxMdu; A, I -- maTiTxge: \eng{why are you so angry} niVneVke iSoTxMdu koVpagoMDididxVye? \eng{they were so pleased that they gave us a bonus} avarige eSuTx saMtoVSavAgitetxMdare avaru namage oMdu boVnasf koTTxru; namage oMdu boVnasf koDuva maTiTxge avaru saMtuSaTxrAgidadxru. \eng{so many men, so many minds} eSoTxMdu maMdiyoV aSoTxMdu manasusxgaLu, aBipArxyagaLu, BAvanegaLu. 
\num{2} (niSeVdhavAciyoDane) aSuTx; aSaTxra -- maTiTxge, tanaka, varege: \eng{was not so late as I expected} nAnu niriVkiSxsidaSuTx taDavAgalillx. \eng{am not so eager as you} ninanxSuTx nAnu kAtaranAgillx. \eng{so expensive that few can afford it} eSuTx dubAriyeMdare adanunx koLaLxlu yArigU sAdhayxvillx. \eng{so small as to be invisible} kANisadaSuTx cikakxdAgide. \eng{am not so foolish as to agree to that} nAnu adakekx opipxge niVDuvaSuTx daDaDxnallx. \eng{did not expect to live so long} aSuTx diVGaRkAl badukuvudanunx niriVkiSxsalillx. 
\num{3} aMte; hAge; hiVge: \eng{I want to leave and so does she} nAnu hoVgabeVkeMdidedxVne, aMteyeV avaLU. \eng{you said it was good, and so it is} adu cenAnxgideyeMdu niVnu heVLide, adu hAgeyeV ide. \eng{why are you panting so ?} niVneVke hiVge Edusiru biDutitxdidxVye? \eng{as the tree falls, so it must lie} mara heVge biVLutatxdeyoV hAgeyeV adu bidudxkoMDirabeVku. \eng{so , and so only, can it be done} hAge, matutx hAge mAtarxveV, adanunx mADalu sAdhayx. 
\num{4} iSuTx; aSuTx; aSaTxra maTiTxge: \eng{so high you cannot reach it} ninage eTukalAradaSuTx etatxradalilx. \eng{have known him since he was so high} avanu (keYyiMda toVrisutAtx) iSuTx etatxradavanAgidAdxginiMda nAnu avananunx balelx. 
\num{5}bahaLa; tuMba; eSoTxV (paTuTx): \eng{so many worlds!} eSoTxMdu loVkagaLu. \eng{so much to do} eSoTxMdu kelsa (mADabeVkAgide). \eng{I am so glad} nanage tuMba saMtoVSavAgide. \eng{she is so beautiful} avaLu eSuTx celuve! \eng{that is ever so easy} adu bahaLa sulBa. \eng{that is ever so much better} adu bahaLa meVlu. 
\num{6} (sithxtiyanunx sUcisuva \kirx gaLoDane) hAge; aMte; vaNiRsida sithxtiyalilx, riVtiyalilx, parxkAra: \eng{stand just so} savxlpx hAge niMtuko. \eng{am not very fond of it, but may become so} nanage adu bahaLa iSaTxvAdudeVnU allx, Adare hAge AguvaMtAgabahudu. \eng{he is better so} avanu aMtiruvudeV meVlu. \eng{perhaps, it is not so} pArxyashaH adu hAgillx. 
\num{7} (\eng{say, think} modalAda \kirx gaLoDane) hAge; aMte; hAgeMdu; hiVgeMdu; aMtu; iMtu; hiMde heVLidaMte yA nirUpisidaMte: \eng{so he said} avanu aMte heVLida. \eng{I think so} nAnu hAge BAvisutetxVne, aMdukoLuLxtetxVne. \eng{so I should hope} hAgeMdu nAnu naMbabeVku, niriVkiSxsabeVku. 
\num{8} hAge; hiVge; aMte; A riVti; A parxkAra: \eng{so run that you may win} gelulxvaMte ODu. \eng{so it was I became a sailor} nAnu nAvikanAdadudx A riVtiyalilx. 
\num{9} jotege; matutx; saha; kUDa; nijvAgi; vAsatxvadalilx: \eng{well, so did I} sari, nAnu kUDa adanunx mADide. \eng{yes, I denied it, but (\engit{or} and) so did you} nAnu adanunx illxveMde, Adare (matutx) niVnU adanenxV mADide. \eng{your birthday? so it is} ninanx huTiTxda hababxveV? hwdu; adu nij. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{and so} (\pArxparx) AmeVle; anaMtara; taruvAya; baLika: \eng{and so to dinner} AmeVle UTkekx (hoVdaru). \eng{and so to bed} baLika malgalu (hoVdaru). 
\hypertarget{so pagu2}{} 
\numi{2} \eng{and so forth} 
\banum
\alnum{a} inUnx hAgeyeV, hiVgeyeV; itAyxdi; matutx aMthavu; modalAdavu. 
\alnum{b} aveV riVtigaLalilx; avugaLaMtaha vidhAnagaLalilx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} \eng{(and) so much of} -ra aSuTx matutx -ra iSuTx; oMdu KcitavAda Adare iSuTx eMdu sapxSaTxvAgi heVLadiruva saMKeyx, motatx, \mo vu: \eng{so much of one ingredient and so much of another} oMdu parikaradudx aSuTx matutx inonxMdaradudx iSuTx. 
\num{4} \eng{and so on} = \hyperlink{so pagu2}{\pagu\ $(2)$}. 
\num{5} \eng{at so much} iSuTx; iSaTxraMte; aSuTx; aSaTxraMte: \eng{at so much a week} vArakakxSuTx. \eng{at so much a head} talegiSaTxraMte. 
\num{6} \eng{\hyperref{kandict_e.pdf}{E}{ever nuga(7)}{ever} so.}. 
\num{7} \eng{\hyperref{kandict_e.pdf}{E}{every nuga(6)}{every} so often.} 
\hypertarget{so pagu8}{} 
\num{8} \eng{(in) so \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{far(1) pagu(5)}{${}^1$far} as.} 
\num{9} \eng{I suppose so} (anumAnisutAtx opipxge sUcisuva parxyoVga) nanagU hAgeyeV -- toVrutatxde, kANisutatxde, aninxsutatxde. 
\num{10} \eng{(it is} \mo vanunx adhAyxhAra mADi) \eng{if so (= if it is so )} hAgidadxlilx. \eng{how so ?} (adu) heVge? \eng{why so ?} (adu) Eke hAge? \eng{`he went off yesterday'. `so?' (= `is that so ?')} `avanu nenenx horaTuhoVda'. `hwdeV?'. 
\num{11} \eng{I told you so} adanunx hAgeMdu modaleV nAnu ninage heVLidedx, ecacxrisidedx (nAnu ninage ecacxrike heVLidudx vayxthaRvAyitu eMbathaRdalilx). 
\numi{12} \eng{just so} 
\banum
\alnum{a} bahaLa ecacxrikeyiMda mADalAgide yA vayxvasethxgoLisalAgide. 
\alnum{b} (samamxti sUcisuva mayARdeya mAtAgi) sari(yAgide); samamxta(vAgide). 
\eanum
\numie
\num{13} \eng{more so} (adeV vasutx \mo vugaLu) inUnx hecucx; inUnx hecicxna maTTxdalilx; inUnx adhikavAgi. 
\num{14} \eng{not so} hAgirada; aSuTx Agillxda; niriVkiSxsidaSuTx yA heVLidadxSuTx Agirada: \eng{not so difficult} aSuTx kaSaTxvallxda. 
\hypertarget{so pagu15}{} 
\numi{15} \eng{not so much as} 
\banum
\alnum{a} -kikxMta kaDime; aSiTxllxde: \eng{he is not so much discontented as unsatisfied} avanige taqpitxyAgillxveV vinA ataqpitxyAgillx. \eng{he is not so much un-intelligent as uneducated} avanu avidAyxvaMtaneV vinA daDaDxnallx; avanige korateyAgiruvudu vidAyxBAyxsa, baudidhxyallx. 
\alnum{b} aSUTx, adU, saha, kUDa: \eng{did not so much as glance at it} adara kaDe noVDi kUDa noVDalillx, noVDalU illx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{16} \eng{or so} (motatx, saMKeyx, \mo vanunx sUcisuva shabadxgaLa taruvAya \parx) sumAru; hecucx kaDame: \eng{send me ten \engit{or} so} nanage sumAru $10$ kaLuhisu. \eng{a pound \engit{or} so will do} savxlpx hecucxkaDame oMdu pwMDf sAku. 
\numi{17} \eng{so as to} 
\banum
\alnum{a} aSuTx; A parxmANdalilx: \eng{not so big a fool as to believe that} adanunx naMbauvaSuTx daDaDxnallx. 
\alnum{b} aMte; hAge; A riVti: \eng{I will have everything ready so as not to keep you waiting} ninanxnunx kAyisadaMte nAnu ellxvanUnx sidadhxpaDisirutetxVne. 
\alnum{c} udedxVshadiMda; hAgAgalu; adakAkxgi: \eng{put it so as not to offend him} avanige asamAdhAna vAgadaMte heVLu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{18} \eng{so be it} (opipxge, vidhiyillxde samamxtisuvudu, \mo vugaLalilx) sari, Agali; hAgeyeV Agali; tathAsutx. 
\num{19} \eng{so -called} (sAmAnayxvAgi, aneVka veVLe tapApxgi) kareyalAgiruva; karediruva; enanxlAda; heVLalAda; hesaru hoMdiruva. 
\num{20} \eng{so \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{far(1) pagu(6)}{far}.} 
\num{21} \eng{so far forth as} (\pArxparx) = \hyperlink{so pagu8}{\pagu$(8)$}. 
\num{22} \eng{so far from} adara badalu, badalAgi; tiVra virudadhxvAgi: \eng{so far from being a help, he was a hindrance} sahAyavAgiruvudara badalu avanu oMdu aDiDxyAda. 
\num{23} \eng{so long!} (\AmA) (matetx BeVTiyAguvavarege) namasAkxra! 
\numi{24} \eng{so long as} 
\banum
\alnum{a} hAgidadxre, aMtidadxlilx -- mAtarx; SaratitxgoLapaTuTx; karArige badadhxvAgi: \eng{you may borrow the book so long as you keep it clean} pusatxkavanunx cokakxTvAgiTuTxkoLuLxva hAgidadxre mAtarx niVnu adanunx eravalu paDeyabahudu. 
\alnum{b} (kAlAvadhi \mo vanunx sUcisuvAga) aduvaregU, -varege, -tanaka. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{25} \eng{so many} 
\banum
\alnum{a} aSuTx saMKeyxya: \eng{as many men, so many minds} eSuTx jnaroV aSuTx manasusxgaLu. 
\alnum{b} aSuTx; anidiRSaTx saMKeyxya: \eng{so many eggs} aSuTx moTeTxgaLu. 
\alnum{c} keVval aSeTxV; adakikxMta beVreyeVnallx; adakikxMta hececxVnallx: \eng{went down like so many skittles} keVval aSuTx sikxTlf (ATda) gUTgaLaMte uruLihoVdaru. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{26} \eng{so much} 
\banum
\alnum{a} aSuTx parxmANda; hecucx; vipul; doDaDx; aSuTx doDaDx motatx, saMKeyx, \mo vu: \eng{is so much nonsense} aSuTx doDaDx aviveVka. 
\alnum{b} aSuTx; iSuTx; anidiRSaTx motatxda: \eng{so much butter} aSuTx beNeNx. \eng{so much sugar} iSuTx sakakxre. \eng{dinner at so much per head} talA obabxrige iSaTxraMte UT. 
\alnum{c} aSuTx; aSaTxramaTiTxge: \eng{if he does not turn up, so much the better} avanu baradidadxre aSaTxramaTiTxge oLeLxyadu. 
\alnum{d} keVval; bari; pUtiR; adu biTuTx EnU illx: \eng{so much rubbish} aSUTx bari kacaDa, shudadhx holsu. 
\alnum{e} (niSeVdhAthaRkadoDane) = \hyperlink{so pagu15}{\pagu\ $(15)$}. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{27} \eng{so much for} adara viSayakekx (heVLabeVkAdudu, mADabeVkAdudu) aSeTxV; iSeTxV; aSuTx sAku: \eng{so much for the first stage of our journey} namamx parxyANda modal haMtada bagegx iSuTx (sAku). 
\num{28} \eng{so please you} tamamx anugarxhadiMda; tamamx kaqpeyiMda. 
\num{29} \eng{so so} hAge hAgeyeV; aSaTxSeTxV; sAmAnayx; sAdhAraNavAda; visheVSaveVnU illxda. 
\num{30} \eng{so sorry!} (\AmA) (tapopxpipxkoLuLxvAga, pashAcxtAtxpa sUcisuvAga heVLuva) kaSxmisi! 
\numi{31} \eng{so that} 
\banum
\alnum{a} aMtAgaleMdu; A udedxVshadiMda; hAgAgaleMdu: \eng{warned him so that he might escape the danger} avanu apAyadiMda tapipxsikoLaLxleMdu ecacxrike koTeTx. 
\alnum{b} adariMdAgi; adara -- pariNAmavAgi, PalvAgi: \eng{all precautions have been taken, so that we expect to succeed} ellx ecacxrikegaLanUnx tegedukoLaLxlAgide, adariMdAgi nAvu gelulxtetxVveMdu niriVkiSxsutetxVve. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{32} \eng{so that's that} (\AmA) (heVLike, vAda, kelsa, \mo vanunx mukAtxyagoLisuvalilx) viSaya aSuTx; saMgati hAgide; aMtU oTiTxnalilx iSuTx. 
\num{33} \eng{so to \hyperlink{say(1) pagu(37)}{${}^1$say} (\engit{or} speak).} 
\hypertarget{so(1)34}{} 
\numi{34} \eng{so what?} (\AmA) 
\banum
\alnum{a} aMdare Enu? adariMdeVnu? adariMda Enu Ada hAge Ayitu? 
\alnum{b} adariMda nanageVnu? adanunx nAneVke gamanisabeVku?: \eng{he hates me, so what?} avanu nananxnunx devxVSisutAtxne, adariMda nanageVnu (naSaTx)? 
\eanum

\bentry

\bnum
\num{1} Atamx; vayxkitxya deVhakikxMta BinanxvAda, amaraveMdu BAvisalAda, AdhAyxtimxka tatatxvX: \eng{immortality of the soul} Atamxda amaratavx, amaqtatavx. 
\num{2} (mAnavana yA pArxNiya) parxkaqti; savxBAva; neYtika yA BAvuka yA bwdidhxka savxBAva: \eng{his whole soul revolted from the heinous act} Atana iDiV Atamx, neYtika savxBAva, A heVyavAda kaqtayxkekx heVsikoMDitu. \eng{he has a soul above such trivialities} avanalilx iMtha kuSxllxka viSayagaLanunx mIruva dhamARdhamaR BAvaneyoMdide. 
\num{3} Atamx; ceVtana; ceYtanayx; jiVva matutx ceVtasusx. 
\num{4} pArxN; jiVvALa; jiVvadusiru; yAvudeV saMsethx, pakaSx, udayxma, \mo vugaLa iravu, uLivu, parxgati, saPalte, \mo vakekx kAraNBUtanAda vayxkitx: \eng{he was the life and soul of the party} avaneV A pakaSxda jiVvadusirAgidadx. 
\num{5} jiVva; jiVvALa; Atamx; sAra; satatxvX; \kanmu\ kalAkaqtigaLu \mo vugaLalilx kaMDubaruva bwdidhxka yA BAvuka shakitx: \eng{his paintings lack soul} avana vaNRcitarxgaLalilx jiVvaveV illx, satatxvxveV illx. 
\numi{6} (yAvudeV BAvane, kalpxne, tatatxvX, AdashaR, neYtika yA bwdidhxka guN, \mo vugaLa) 
\banum
\alnum{a} mAdari; AdashaRrUpa: \eng{the very soul of discretion} viveVkada -- mAdari, AdashaRrUpa. 
\alnum{b} sAkAramUtiR; mUtaR(savx)rUpa: \eng{he lived a saintly life even like the greatest souls of antiquity} pArxciVna kAlda sherxVSaThx sAdhusaMtaraMteyeV, mahAtamxraMteyeV avanU saha saMtajiVvanavanunx naDesutitxdadx. \eng{he left the task to meaner souls} A kAyaRvananxvanu kuSxdarx vayxkitxgaLige biTTx. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{7} 
\banum
\alnum{a} vayxkitx; manuSayx; (\AmA) piLeLx; AsAmi; pArxNi: \eng{not a soul to speak to for miles around} sutatxmutatx meYligaTTxLe noVDidarU mAtanADalu oMdu narapiLeLx saha iralillx. 
\alnum{b} (\bava) jna: \eng{the ship went down with $200$ souls} A haDagu $200$ jnara sameVta muLugihoVyitu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} (\AmA) (salige, anugarxha BAva, maruka yA kanikara, tirasAkxra, \mo vanunx sUcisuvalilx) pArxNi; baDapAyi; baDajiVva: \eng{he's a good soul} avanoMdu oLeLxya pArxNi. \eng{he was a simple soul} avanobabx tiVra saraLa vayxkitx, EnU ariyada pArxNi. \eng{the poor soul had lost her way} A baDapAyige dAri tapipxhoVgitutx. 
\num{9} niVgorxVtavx; niVgorxV -- saMsakxqqti, saMgiVta, \mo vu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{\hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{all(1) pagu(13)}{${}^1$all} Souls' Day.} 
\num{2} \eng{commend one's soul to God} (maraNshayeyxyalilxruva vayxkitxge heVLuva upadeVsha) ninanx Atamxvanunx Bagavatakxqqpege opipxsu, samapiRsu. 
\num{3} \eng{he cannot call his soul his own} avanu tananx savxMta jiVvavanenxV tananxdu enunxva hAgillx; avanu beVrobabx vayxkitxya pArxbalyxkokxLapaTuTx shudAdhxMgavAgi asavxtaMtarxnAgi hoVgidAdxne. 
\num{4} \eng{keep \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{body(1) nuga(4)}{${}^1$body} and soul together.} 
\num{5} \eng{lost souls} naSATxtamxru; pAtakigaLu; narakayAtirxgaLu. 
\num{6} \eng{sell one's soul for} bayasidadxnunx paDedukoLaLxlu tananx AtamxvanenxV mAriko; atayxMta sherxVSaThxvAda vasutxvanUnx teru, koTuTxbiDu. 
\num{7} \eng{soul kiss} gADha cuMbana; gADhavAda mututx. 
\num{8} \eng{soul mate} anurUpa saMgAti; AdashaR saMgAti; gADhasenxVha matutx tananxMteyeV yoVcisuva manasusxLaLx -- vayxkitx. 
\num{9} \eng{the soul of honour} gwravada sAkAramUtiR; mayARdA puruSa; gwravakekx cuyxti uMTAguva, mayARde keDuva naDenuDi sAdhayxvillxda vayxkitx. 
\numi{10} \eng{upon my soul} 
\banum
\alnum{a} nanAnxNe; nananx pArxNda ANe, jiVvadANe; nananx Atamxda meVlANe. 
\alnum{b} (AshacxyaRsUcaka udAgxra) are!

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (mAtugaLanunx, shabadxgaLanunx) ADu; heVLu; enunx; ore; usuru; ucacxrisu. 
\num{2} (tananx aBipArxyavanunx, nijAMshavanunx) heVLu; heVLi tiLisu; horageDahu; vayxkatxpaDisu; shurxtapaDisu. 
\num{3} (hesarisida) BASeyanunx mAtADu; ADu: \eng{I cannot speak French} nAnu pherxMcf BASeyanunx ADalAre, mAtADalAre. 
\num{4} (haDaganunx) kUgi karedu -- saMkeVta koDu, samAcAra tiLisu. 
\num{5} (\pArxparx) (vayxkitxya naDavaLike, saMdaBaR, \mo vugaLa \vi) iMthavaneMdu yA iMthadeMdu -- heVLu, sUcisu, toVrisu, parxkaTisu: \eng{his conduct speaks him generous} avanu udAri eMbaudanunx avana naDavaLikeyeV heVLutatxde, toVrisutatxde. 
\num{6} (\pArxparx) (yAvudakekxV) kuruhAgiru; sAkiSxyAgiru: \eng{the loud laugh that speaks the vacant mind} ciMteyillxda, nirALavAda, manasisxge kuruhAda keVke, gaTiTxyAda nagu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} mAtADu; nuDi; usuru: \eng{he is unable to speak after his stroke} avanige lkAvx hoDeda baLika, pAshavxRvAyu tagulida baLika, mAtADalu ashakatxnAgidAdxne. \eng{I wish you would speak distinctly} niVnu sapxSaTxvAgi mAtADidare cenAnxgirutatxde. \eng{Hello, (this is) Narayan speaking} (TeliphoVnf) haloV, mAtanADutitxruvavanu nAnu, nArAyaNf. 
\num{2} (vayxkitxyoDane) mAtADu; saMBASisu; saMvAda naDesu: \eng{I will speak to the Director about this matter} I viSayavAgi nideRVshakaroDane mAtADutetxVne. 
\num{3} (yAvudeV viSayavanunx baraha \mo\ rUpadalilx) heVLu; tiLisu; parxsAtxpisu: \eng{speaks of it in his novel} tananx kAdaMbariyalilx adanunx parxsAtxpisutAtxne. 
\num{4} (saBe, nAyxyAdhipati, nAyxyavicAraNA maMDali, \mo vugaLa edurinalilx, samumxKdalilx) mAtADu; BASaN mADu: \eng{spoke for an hour} oMdu GaMTeya kAl mAtADida, BASaN mADida. 
\num{5} yAvudaradeV paravAgi yA yAvudanenxV samathiRsutAtx mAtADu: \eng{I shall speak for the resolution} nAnu masUdeya paravAgi mAtanADutetxVne, masUdeyanunx samathiRsutetxVne. \eng{he has a good speaking voice} avanige BASaNkekx anukUlvAda dhavxni ide. 
\num{6} (beVTenAyiya \vi) ULu; ULiDu; baguLu. 
\num{7} (saMgiVta vAdayxgaLa \vi) nAda mADu; dani koDu. 
\num{8} (baMdUku \mo vugaLa \vi) sadudx mADu; sadAdxgu. 
\num{9} (\AmA) tegaLu; dUSisu: \eng{spoke to them about their lateness} avara CAnasada bagegx dUSisada. 
\num{10} mAtina yA barahada mUlka (beVrobabx vayxkitx \mo vara) BAvane, aBipArxya, anisikegaLanunx -- tiLisu, heVLu, aBivayxkitxgoLisu, vayxkatxpaDisu: \eng{speaks for our generation} namamx talemArinavara aBipArxyagaLanunx vayxkatxpaDisutAtxne. 
\num{11} (\kAparx) BAva \mo vanunx tiLisu; parxBAva biVru; muTuTx; taTuTx: \eng{the sunset spoke to her} sUyARsatx avaLanunx taTiTxtu. \eng{Nature spoke to Lucy} parxkaqti lUsige tiLisitu (lUsiya meVle pariNAma biVritu). 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{ill-spoken} keTTx mAtugaLanAnxDuva; duBARSiyAda. 
\num{2} \eng{not (\engit{or} nothing) to speak of} heVLikoLuLxvaMthadeVnU illx; heVLikoLuLxvaMtha (doDaDx) viSayaveVnU allx; lekakxkekx tegedu koLuLxva viSayaveVnU allx; heVLuvaMthadudx (vAsatxvikavAgi) EnU illx; heVLabahudAda visheVSaveVnU illx. 
\num{3} \eng{smooth-spoken} nayavAgi mAtanADuva; maqduBASiyAda. 
\num{4} \eng{so to \hyperlink{say(1) pagu(37)}{${}^1$say} (or speak).} 
\numi{5} \eng{speak for} 
\banum
\alnum{a} obabxna paravAgi mAtanADu; obabxna vakAtxranAgiru; obabxna BAva-BAvanegaLanunx, iMgita manoVratha gaLanunx (beVrobabxrige) heVLu, tiLiyapaDisu. 
\alnum{b} \eng{= \hyperref{kandict_b.pdf}{B}{bespeak}{bespeak}.} 
\hypertarget{speak pagu6}{} 
\eanum
\numie
\num{6} \eng{speak for itself} savxtaH sAkiSxyAgiru; beVre sAkiSx beVkAgillxdiru: \eng{the course pursued by him speaks for itself} Ata hiDidiruva hAdi savxtaH sAkiSxyAgide. 
\numi{7} \eng{speak for oneself} 
\banum
\alnum{a} tananx savxMta aBipArxya mAtarx -- tiLisu, heVLu, koDu. 
\alnum{b} itarara aBipArxyagaLanunx parxtinidhisalu toDagabeVDa:\eng{I can only speak for myself; I am not concerned with other's views} nAnu nananx savxMta aBipArxyavanunx mAtarx heVLabalelx; itarara aBipArxyada goDave nanage beVkillx. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{8} \eng{speak one's mind} manasisxnalilxdadxdadxnunx mucucxmare yillxde, sapxSaTxvAgi, nidARkiSxNyxvAgi -- heVLibiDu; aBipArxyavanunx tiLisalu, heVLalu hiMtegeyabeVDa, dAkiSxNyxpaDabeVDa. 
\hypertarget{speak pagu9}{} 
\numi{9} \eng{speak out} 
\banum
\alnum{a} gaTiTxyAgi bAyibiTuTx -- heVLu; sapxSaTxvAgi heVLu. 
\alnum{b} = \eng{\hyperlink{speak pagu6}{\pagu $(6)$}.} 
\alnum{c} savxMta aBipArxya tiLisu.

\alnum{b} aMtaHkaraN; manasusx; AMtayaR; aMtaraMga: \eng{in the spirit} manadalilx; AMtayaRdalilx; aMtaraMga dalilx: \eng{I shall be with you in the spirit} manasA, AMtayaRdalilx, aMtaraMgadalilx, nAnu ninonxDaneyeV irutetxVne. \eng{he groaned in spirit} avanu manasisxnalelxV yAtanepaTTx. \eng{he was vexed in spirit} avanu AMtayaRdalilx duguDagoMDa. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{3} (sharxdedhx , utAsxha, niSeThx, AdashaR, \mo\ sherxVSaThx guNgaLuLaLx) vayxkitx; jiVvi: \eng{he was one of the most ardent spirits of his time} Ata tananx kAlda atayxMta utAsxhi vayxkitxgaLalolxbabxnAgidadx. \eng{it was a meeting of the choicest spirits} adoMdu atayxMta niSAThxvaMtara samAveVshavAgitutx. 
\num{4} amUtaRceVtana; Atamx; cinAmxtarx savxrUpi; Bwtavillxda Adare viveVcane, baudidhxshakitx iruva vayxkitx; ceVtana savxrUpi; keVval cinamxya: \eng{God is the supreme spirit} BagavaMta, paramAtamx parama cinamxya. 
\num{5} amUtaR -- vayxkitx, jiVvi; (pheVri, yakaSx, gaMdhavaR, apasxrAdigaLu, BUtaperxVta pishAcAdigaLu, \mo) alwkika jiVvi, vayxkitx: \eng{spirits must have been at work in performing this marvel} I aduBxtavanenxsaguvalilx alwkika vayxkitxgaLeV toDagididxrabeVku. \eng{haunted by spirits} pishAcagarxsatx. 
\num{6} kecucx; kalitana; dheYyaR; dhiVra parxvaqtitx; satatxvX: \eng{a man of unbending spirit} yArigU maNiyada dhiVra. \eng{if you had the spirit of a mouse, you would not have quailed like this} ninanxlilx oMdu iliyalilxruvaSATxdarU kecicxdidxdadxre hiVge niVnu gaDagaDa naDugutitxralillx. 
\num{7} hurupu; humamxsusx; ceYtanayx; dheYyoRVtAsxha: \eng{Napoleon infused spirit into his men} nepoVliyananxnu tananx BaTaralilx dheYyoRVtAsxhavanunx tuMbautitxdadx. 
\num{8} (yAvudaradeV) jiVva; jiVvALa; ceYtanayx; AtamxsavxrUpa; pArxNpArxya; aMtaHsUPxtiR; perxVrakashakitx : \eng{he was the animating spirit of the revolution} avanu A kArxMtiya ceYtanayxveV Agidadx. 
\numi{9} 
\banum
\alnum{a} savxBAva; shiVl; parxkaqti; (vayxkitxya) mAnasika yA neYtika -- savxBAva yA guN: \eng{a man of unbending spirit} bagagxda savxBAvada vayxkitx. 
\alnum{b} avugaLiMda kUDida vayxkitx: \eng{is an ardent spirit} humamxsusxLaLx, utAsxhi vayxkitx. 
\alnum{c} aMtarAtamx; aMtaHparxvaqtitx; oLa olvu: \eng{the spirit moves a person} vayxkitxyanunx avana aMtarAtamx perxVrisutatxde. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{10} parxvaqtitx; manoVvaqtitx; manoVdhamaR; daqSiTx: \eng{he took it in the right spirit} avanu adanunx sariyAda daqSiTxyalilx aMgiVkarisida. \eng{a spirit of mischief} keVDiga parxvaqtitx. \eng{you must enter into the spirit of a thing} niVnu adara manoVdhamaRvanunx aritukoLaLxbeVku, adara manoVdhamaRkekx hoMdikoLaLxbeVku. 
\num{11} manoVBAva; Ashaya; aMtarAthaR; nijvAda aBipArxya; iMgita: \eng{took it in the wrong spirit} adara tapupx athaRdalilx garxhisida. \eng{consider the spirit of the law, not the letter} shAsanada, kAnUnina iMgitavanunx parigaNisu, akaSxravananxllx (shabadxgaLananxllx). 
\num{12} (kAl, yuga, \mo vugaLa) parxvaqtitx; savxBAva; dhamaR: \eng{one cannot resist the spirit of the age} yAreV Agali yugadhamaRvanunx taDeyalu sAdhayxvillx. 
\num{13} (\pArxparx) (ceVtana parxpaMcada vidayxmAnagaLanunx niyaMtirxsuva shakitxyeMdu hiMde BAvisidadx) apArxkaqta shakitx: \eng{animal spirits} sahajoVtAsxha; huTuTxhumamxsusx; huTiTxniMdaleV baMda, sAvxBAvikavAda utAsxha, humamxsusx.

\num{17} sipxriTuTx; madAyxkaR; TiMkacxru; AlokxhAlinalilx viliVnagoLisida bASapxshiVl darxva.

\banum

\numie

\noindent
\gl{\sakirx}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} (vasutx yA adara tudiyanunx) cucucx; oLahoVgisu; tUrisu: \eng{stuck a finger in my eye} nananx kaNiNxna oLakekx beraLu cucicxda. \eng{stick the bayonet through the breast} edeyoLakekx saniVnu hogisu, tUrisu. \eng{stick a pin through it} adaroLakekx guMDusUji cucucx. 
\num{2} (monacu tudiyiMda) cucucx; iri; tivi: \eng{I will pull out my knife and stick you} nananx cAku hiridu ninanxnunx iriyutetxVne. \eng{stick the spurs in the horse's sides} rikApina moneyiMda kudureya pakekxgaLanunx tivi. 
\num{3} (moneyanunx) nATu; neDu; cucucx : \eng{cake stuck (over) with almonds} bAdAmi biVj nATida keVku. \eng{pin cushion stuck full of pins} tuMba guMDusUji cucicxda sUjimetetx. 
\num{4} (salAki \mo vugaLa moneya meVle yA moneya meVle heVgoV hAge) cucicxDu; sikikxsu; sikikxsiDu; neDu; nATisu (\akirx\ saha): \eng{the heads of the beheaded were stuck on the spikes of the gateway} diDiDx bAgilina salAkigaLa monegaLa meVle shiraceCxVda hoMdidavara talegaLanunx sikikxsalAgitutx. \eng{the arrows stuck in the target} A bANgaLu gurihalgeyalilx nATikoMDuvu. \eng{a piece of needlework with the needle stuck in it} sUjiyanunx sikikxsida kasUti baTeTx. \eng{stick the feather in your cap} A gariyanunx ninanx ToVpige sikikxsiko. \eng{stick the rose in the buttonhole} guMDiya tUtige gulAbi hUvanunx sikikxsiko. \eng{stick pen behind one's ear} kiviya hiMde penanxnunx sikikxsiko. 
\num{5} (\kanmu\ avasaradalilx) aDADxdiDiDxyAgi hAku; alilx ililx iDu: \eng{stick a few commas in it} kelvu alpx virAma cihenxgaLanunx allxlilx hAku, seVrisu. \eng{just stick it on the table, (\engit{or} down anywhere)} idanunx sumamxne meVjina meVle (yA elolxV oMdu kaDe) iDu, hAku: \eng{stick your cap on} ninanx ToVpiyanunx taleya meVle hAkiko, iTuTxko. \eng{stick them in your pocket} avugaLanunx ninanx jeVbinalilxTuTxko. 
\num{6} (aMTu \mo vugaLiMda) aMTisu; hatitxsu; hacucx; kacicxsu: \eng{stick label} leVballxnunx, ciVTiyanunx -- aMTisu, hacucx. \eng{stick a postage stamp} aMceya sATxMpanunx aMTisu, hacucx. \eng{stick it on the bill} Bititxpatarxda meVle adanunx aMTisu. 
\num{7} (\AmA) tALiko; taDeduko; sahisu; sahisiko: \eng{I cannot stick that worthless fellow} A ayoVgayxnanunx nAnu sahisalAre. \eng{I couldn't stick it any longer} inunx (muMde) adanunx taDedukoLaLxlu, sahisikoMDiralu, nanage sAdhayxvillx. 
\num{8} (vayxkitxya meVle yAvudakekxV Agali) doVSAroVpaNe mADu; tapupx horisu. 
\num{9} (giDakekx, baLiLxge UreyAgi) koVlnunx -- kaTuTx, neDu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent 
\gl{\akirx}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} aMTiko; kacicxko; hatitxko:\eng{this envelope will not stick} I lkoVTeyu aMTikoLuLxvudillx. \eng{sticks like a bur} aMTupuraLeyaMte aMTikoLuLxtatxde. 
\num{2} uLi; uLidukoMDiru; kacicxkoMDiru; aMTikoMDiru: \eng{the nickname stuck to her} A aDaDxhesareV avaLige aMTikoMDitu. \eng{the memory of it still sticks in my mind} adara nenapu nananx manasisxnalilx inUnx uLidukoMDeV ide. 
\num{3} (\AmA) iruva jAgakekx aMTikoMDiru; (idadx jAgavanunx biDade) idadxlelxV iru; kacicxkoMDiru: \eng{are you going to stick indoors all day?} hagalellx maneyoLageV kacicxkoMDirutitxVyA? 
\num{4} (\AmA) (dUru, apavAda, ApAdane, ivugaLa \vi) kacicxko; aMTiko; nijvAdadedxMdu toVru: \eng{they could not make the charges stick} A AroVpagaLanunx sAdhAraveMdu, vishAvxsAhaRveMdu toVrisalu avarige sAdhayxvAgalillx. 
\num{5} (GaSaRN, vAyubadadhxte, aDiDx yA parxtibaMdhaka, \mo vugaLiMda) kacicxkoMDubiTiTxru; sikikx (hAki)ko; calisadaMte yA kAyaR mADadaMte Agu: \eng{the boat is stuck on sand bank} I doVNi maraLudiNeNxyalilx hUtuhoVgide. \eng{this drawer is stuck} I are sikikxkoMDide. \eng{I somehow got through ten lines but then (got) stuck} hatutx sAlugaLanunx heVgoV mugiside, Adare AmeVle gaMTlu sikikxkoMDitu. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\numi{1} \eng{be stuck for} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (upAya, AloVcane, pada, \mo vu) hoLeyadiru; toVcadiru. 
\alnum{b} (yAvudeV oMdu) beVkAgiru; agatayxvAgiru; apeVkiSxtavAgiru.

\numie
\num{2} \eng{be stuck on} (\AmA) (yAvudaradeV) moVhakekx bididxru; moVha hiDidiru; giVLu -- hatitxru, hiDidiru. 
\num{3} \eng{be stuck with} (\AmA) sikikxbididxru; biDisikoLaLxlu, kaDidukoLaLxlu, pArAgalu -- Agadiru; shAshavxtavAgi sikikxkoMDiru; kAyaM Agi saMbaMdha hoMdiru.

\num{6} \eng{stick at it} (oMdanunx) paTATxgi hiDidiru; biDadiru; biDade parxyatinxsu.

\numi{8} \eng{stick by (\engit{or} with \engit{or} to)} 
\banum

\alnum{b} nereyalelxV, hatitxraveV, samIpadalilxyeV -- iru.

\numie
\num{9} \eng{stick'em up!} (\AmA) (sharaNAgu, parxtiBaTisabeVDa eMdu sUcisuva mAtAgi) keY(gaLanunx) etutx! 
\numi{10} \eng{stick fast}

\num{7} (rekekx, doVNiya huTuTx, \mo vugaLa) oMdu pUtiR -- biVsu, hoDeta. 
\num{8} (koMtada yA ADubeNeya yAvudeV kaDegina) eDeyAT; oMdu paTiTxna calne, sarita. 
\num{9} (gAlfphx) ceMDina (gellxMkavAgi parigaNisuva) oMdu hoDeta yA biVsu. 
\numi{10} (doVNi naDesuvudaralilx) 
\banum

\alnum{b} huTiTxna hoDeta: \eng{the second boat is gaining at every stroke} eraDaneya doVNiyu oMdoMdu hoDetakUkx veVga veVgavAgi sAgutitxde.

\num{12} (AT \mo vugaLalilx, bAyxTu \mo vugaLiMda) hoDeyuva riVti; hoDetada -- paTuTx, varise: \eng{he invented a new stroke in cricket} kirxkeTfnalilx avanu oMdu hosabageya hoDetavanunx, variseyanunx saqSiTxsida. 
\num{13} kwshal; neYpuNyx; yashasivxyAda yA kushalvAda, nipuNvAda parxyatanx: \eng{a stroke of wit, diplomacy, etc.} hAsayx kwshal, rAjtaMtarx neYpuNyx, \mo vu.

\alnum{b} (mudarxNdalilxna) aMthadeV gere: \eng{oblique stroke} Ore gere.

\num{15} (vaNRneyoMdaralilx oTTxMdakekx kaLe taruva) yAvudeV vivara, aMsha: \eng{the description is full of strokes from the life} vaNRne badukina vivaragaLiMda, vAsatxvAMshagaLiMda tuMbide.

\gl{\nA}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum

\banum

\alnum{b} vishavxdalilxna (garxhagaLiruva yA illxda) aMtha yAvudeV tAre. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{2} (sUyaRna) beLaku; bisilu; shAK: \eng{let in the sun} sUyaRna beLakanunx oLakekx baragoDu. \eng{keep out the sun} bisilnunx oLakekx baradaMte taDe. 
\num{3} (\kAparx) dina yA vaSaR. 
\num{4} (\kAparx) sUyaR; veYBava, parxBe, teVjsusx, \mo vugaLa AkaraveMdu BAvisalAda vayxkitx yA vasutx. 
\enum
\emng

\noindent
\gl{\pagu}
\expl{}
\bmng
\bnum
\num{1} \eng{against the sun = \hyperref{kandict_a.pdf}{A}{anticlockwise(1)}{${}^1$anti-clockwise}.} 
\num{2} \eng{a place in the sun} anukUl saninxveVsha yA sithxti. 
\num{3} \eng{beneath (\engit{or} under) the sun} parxpaMcadalilx elAlxdarU; loVkadalelxlAlxdarU. 
\hyperdef{S}{sun(1) pagu(4)}{} 
\numi{4} \eng{catch the sun} 
\banum
\alnum{a} bisilu biVLuva sathxLadalilxru. 
\alnum{b} bisillilx bADu, kaMdu. 
\eanum
\numie
\num{5} \eng{hail (\engit{or} adore) the rising sun} hosa yA baraliruva adhikAriyanunx hogaLu, olisiko, avana anugarxha koVru. 
\num{6} \eng{in the sun} bisilinalilx; bisilu biVLuvaMte. 
\num{7} \eng{let not the sun go down upon your wrath} ninanx koVpa oMdu dinada maTiTxgirali; ninanx korxVdhavu saMjeyoLagAgi shAMtavAgali, aDagali. 
\num{8} \eng{make \hyperref{kandict_h.pdf}{H}{hay(1) nuga(2)}{${}^1$hay} while the sun shines.} 
\num{9} \eng{on which the sun never sets} (cakArxdhipatayx \mo vugaLa \vi) sUyaR muLugada; vishavxvAyxpiyAda. 
\num{10} \eng{rise with the sun} sUyoRVdayakekx ELu; hotitxge muMce ELu. 
\num{11} \eng{see the sun} badukiru; jiVvaMtavAgiru: \eng{you'll never see the sun again} niVnu matetx sUyaRnanunx kANuvudillx; niVnu inunx muMde badukalAre. 
\num{12} \eng{sun and planet} swravUyxhada, sUyaR matutx garxhagaLa vayxvasethxya -- geVru, giyaru; madhayxdalilx halulxgaLiruva akaSxdaMDada sutatxlU oMdoV halvoV cikakx cakarxgaLidudx, akaSxdaMDavu tananx akaSxda meVlU, uLida cakarxgaLu adara sutatxlU tirugutAtx cAlneyanunx odagisuva EpARDu, vayxvasethx. 
\num{13} \eng{sun in splendour} (\vaMlAM) kiraNgaLuLaLx, mAnava muKviruva sUyaR. 
\num{14} \eng{sun is set} avana, adara, \mo vugaLa -- ELigeya, aBivaqdidhxya, ucACx rxyada, utakxSaRda, kAl AgihoVyitu; mugidu hoVyitu.

\num{16} \eng{with the sun = \hyperref{kandict_c.pdf}{C}{clockwise(1)}{${}^1$clockwise}.}

\num{2} surakiSxta; BadarxvAda: \eng{put it in a sure place} adanunx oMdu BadarxvAda, surakiSxtavAda -- sathxLadalilxDu. 
\num{3} KAtirxyAda; necacxbahudAda; naMbalhaRvAda; Baravase iDabahudAda; tapapxda; viPalvAgada: \eng{the scheme is sure to turn out well} I yoVjne saPalvAguvudu KAtirx. \eng{there is only one sure way} necacxbahudAda dAri iruvudu oMdeV oMdu. 
\num{4} KMDitavAda; nijvAda; satayxvAda: \eng{one thing is sure} oMdu mAtaMtU KMDita(vAgi nij). 
\num{5} (naMbike yA heVLikege) sAkaSuTx AdhAra iruva yA iruvaMte kANisuva. 
\num{6} manadaTATxda; daqDhavAda naMbike, sharxdedhx, vishAvxsa -- huTiTxda.

\noindent

\bnum
\num{1} \eng{as sure as \hyperref{kandict_f.pdf}{F}{fate(1) nuga}{${}^1$fate}.} 
\numi{2} \eng{be sure} 
\banum
\alnum{a} (vidhayxthaRkadalilx) naMbau; necucx; KAtirxyAgiru.

\eanum
\numie
\num{3} \eng{for sure} (\AmA) nisasxMdeVhavAgi; nisasxMshayavAgi; KMDitavAgi; anumAnaveV illxde. 
\num{4} \eng{I am sure I didn't mean to hurt you} ninanxnunx noVyisabeVkeMba iceCx, udedxVsha, nanage KMDita iralillx. 
\hyperdef{S}{sure(1) pagu(5)}{} 
\numi{5} \eng{make sure} KAtaripaDisu; daqDhapaDisu; KcitapaDisu. 
\banum
\alnum{a} \eng{make sure of} KcitapaDisiko; KAtirxpaDisiko; daqDhapaDisiko. 
\alnum{b} (yAvudeV Agali UhisidadxMteyeV ide eMbaudanunx) rujuvAtu paDisu; sidadhxpaDisu. 
\alnum{c} (yAvudanenxV Agali bayasidaMte AguvaMte) mADu; agatayxvAda kAyaRkarxmavanunx tegeduko: \eng{he made sure of success (\engit{or} succeeding)} tAnu gelulxvudanunx, tananx jyavanunx avanu KcitapaDisikoMDa. 
\eanum
\numie
\numi{7} \eng{to be sure}
